intro: Alkanna graeca, commonly known as the Greek alkanna, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive, bright red to orange rootstock. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically pale yellow to greenish in color. Its roots contain alkaloids and have been used historically in traditional medicine. Alkanna graeca thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or arid environments.
